"In determining the proper sentence the Judge should consider the gravity of the offence as  it appears
from  the  nature of the  act itself and should have  regard to  the  punishment provided in  the  Penal Code
punishment as  a deterrent and consider to  what extent it  will be  effective.  Incidence of crimes of the
nature  of which  the  offender  has  been  found  guilty  and  the  difficulty  of detection  are  also  matters
which  should  receive  due  consideration.  The  Judge  should  also  take  into  account  the  nature  of the
loss to  the  victim and  the  profit that may  accrue  to  the  culprit in the  event of non- detection. Another
matter  to  be  taken  into  account  is  that  the  offences  were  planned  crimes  for  wholesale  profit.  The
